docs.snippet: Roy Hodgson has been asked by the English Football Association to remain as head coach until 2016 despite the team being eliminated at the World Cup group stage for the first time since 1958.
docs.lead_paragraph: Roy Hodgson has been asked by the English Football Association to remain as head coach until 2016 despite the team being eliminated at the World Cup group stage for the first time since 1958.

headline.main: England Asks Hodgson to Stay on Despite Exit
headline.print_headline: England Asks Hodgson to Stay on Despite Exit

docs.snippet: Costa Rica has turned the tables on the team's World Cup expectations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Costa Rica has turned the tables on the team's World Cup expectations.

headline.main: Costa Rica Continues to Surprise by Beating Italy
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica Continues to Surprise by Beating Italy

docs.snippet: As if early exit from the World Cup in Brazil was not depressing enough for England, now they return to the scene of their infamous loss to a team of American amateurs six decades ago.
docs.lead_paragraph: As if early exit from the World Cup in Brazil was not depressing enough for England, now they return to the scene of their infamous loss to a team of American amateurs six decades ago.

headline.main: Don't Mention 1950! England Head to Scene of U.S. Upset
headline.print_headline: Don't Mention 1950! England Head to Scene of U.S. Upset

docs.snippet: Costa Rica captain Bryan Ruiz headed his side into a 1-0 halftime lead against four-times World Cup winners Italy with a 44th-minute goal in their Group D clash on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Costa Rica captain Bryan Ruiz headed his side into a 1-0 halftime lead against four-times World Cup winners Italy with a 44th-minute goal in their Group D clash on Friday.

headline.main: Costa Rica Stun Italy With Ruiz Goal for 1-0 Halftime Lead
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica Stun Italy With Ruiz Goal for 1-0 Halftime Lead

docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama has sent an indirect message to Cuban President Raúl Castro through Uruguay's leader, asking Cuba to release a jailed U.S. aid contractor and encouraging political reforms, U.S. officials said on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama has sent an indirect message to Cuban President Raúl Castro through Uruguay's leader, asking Cuba to release a jailed U.S. aid contractor and encouraging political reforms, U.S. officials said on Friday.

headline.main: Obama, via Uruguay, Urges Cuba to Release Jailed U.S. Citizen
headline.print_headline: Obama, via Uruguay, Urges Cuba to Release Jailed U.S. Citizen

docs.snippet: Had Costa Rica been a less resilient team, it might still be stewing over referee Enrique Osses' refusal to award a penalty when explosive striker Joel Campbell was taken down in the area.
docs.lead_paragraph: Had Costa Rica been a less resilient team, it might still be stewing over referee Enrique Osses' refusal to award a penalty when explosive striker Joel Campbell was taken down in the area.

headline.main: Costa Rica Poised for Its Best World Cup
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica Poised for Its Best World Cup

docs.snippet: Costa Rica buried predictions of their early demise to emerge into the knockout stages of the World Cup for only the second time with a 1-0 Group D win over Italy on Friday that sent England crashing out.
docs.lead_paragraph: Costa Rica buried predictions of their early demise to emerge into the knockout stages of the World Cup for only the second time with a 1-0 Group D win over Italy on Friday that sent England crashing out.

headline.main: Costa Rica Stun Italy to Reach Last-16, England Out
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica Stun Italy to Reach Last-16, England Out

docs.snippet: England's failure at the first hurdle at the Brazil World Cup leaves manager Roy Hodgson with no choice but to put even more faith than he has in untried, emerging talent.
docs.lead_paragraph: England's failure at the first hurdle at the Brazil World Cup leaves manager Roy Hodgson with no choice but to put even more faith than he has in untried, emerging talent.

headline.main: England Failure Leaves Coach Looking Back to the Future
headline.print_headline: England Failure Leaves Coach Looking Back to the Future

docs.snippet: Kyle Beckerman is counting on all his experience playing Major League Soccer games in the heat and humidity to prepare him for what he will face in the World Cup on Sunday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Kyle Beckerman is counting on all his experience playing Major League Soccer games in the heat and humidity to prepare him for what he will face in the World Cup on Sunday.

headline.main: Hydration, Nutrition and Rest Key for US in Manaus
headline.print_headline: Hydration, Nutrition and Rest Key for US in Manaus

docs.snippet: Thousands of Costa Ricans waving the country's blue, white and red flag poured onto the streets of their capital Friday to celebrate the national soccer team's 1-0 victory over Italy in the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of Costa Ricans waving the country's blue, white and red flag poured onto the streets of their capital Friday to celebrate the national soccer team's 1-0 victory over Italy in the World Cup.

headline.main: Costa Ricans Fill Streets to Celebrate Cup Win
headline.print_headline: Costa Ricans Fill Streets to Celebrate Cup Win
